findings: Google Analytics (gtag) integrated for basic tracking
Limited console error visibility for debugging
WordPress emoji support detection with minimal feedback
issues: Minimal error feedback mechanisms for test failures

findings: Basic state manipulation through URL routing
issues: No test mode or debug endpoints detected
Limited direct database manipulation for testing

findings: Straightforward navigation: Blog, QCSD, About sections
Emoji support detection uses canvas rendering
issues: Lack of documentation for decision trees
Obfuscated code makes logic tracing difficult

findings: Quality practices well documented in content

strengths: Extensive testing tools available for WordPress

concerns: Multiple theme/plugin dependencies (Alia theme, WPForms, Contact Form 7)

findings: No visible critical errors in rendered markup
notes: Comprehensive testing needed to verify all edge cases
No console errors during initial assessment

issues: Large page surface area for testing

findings: Clear separation: header, article grid, sidebar, footer
Component-based structure (blog cards, forms, social icons)

recommendations.recommendation: Implement REST API endpoints for programmatic state control. Add test mode with endpoints like /wp-json/test/v1/reset-state and /wp-json/test/v1/seed-data to enable automated testing.
recommendations.implementation: Create WordPress REST API controller with authentication for test environment only. Example: register_rest_route('test/v1', '/reset-state', array('methods' => 'POST', 'callback' => 'reset_test_state', 'permission_callback' => 'is_test_environment'));

recommendations.recommendation: Add source maps for JavaScript and comprehensive inline code comments. Reduce obfuscation in production to aid debugging and testing.
recommendations.implementation: Enable webpack source maps in production build. Add JSDoc comments to all JavaScript functions. Use wp_enqueue_script() with development versions that include comments.

recommendations.recommendation: Implement lazy loading for third-party scripts (Facebook SDK, Google Analytics). Split CSS into critical and non-critical paths. Use WordPress block theme system for better modularity.
recommendations.implementation: Use Intersection Observer API to lazy load analytics. Implement critical CSS extraction with tools like Critical CSS Generator. Defer non-essential JavaScript with async/defer attributes.

recommendations.recommendation: Add WordPress Debug Bar plugin in development. Implement custom logging with error_log() for WordPress actions/filters. Add performance monitoring with Query Monitor plugin.
recommendations.implementation: Install Query Monitor and Debug Bar plugins. Add custom logging: error_log('Test execution: ' . json_encode($state)). Enable WP_DEBUG_LOG in wp-config.php for test environments.

recommendations.recommendation: Create technical documentation including WordPress theme/plugin architecture, REST API endpoints, database schema, and testing procedures. Use phpDocumentor for code documentation.
recommendations.implementation: Generate phpDoc comments for all functions. Create /docs folder with architecture.md, api.md, testing.md. Use WordPress Codex standards for documentation format.

strengths: Standard WordPress technology stack (high similarity score: 88/100)
Good component decomposability enabling isolated testing (79/100)
Low bug rate with graceful error handling (81/100)
weaknesses: Critical: Limited controllability for programmatic testing (55/100)
Critical: Large page size with many dependencies (58/100)
High: Poor code transparency due to obfuscation (45/100)
testingRecommendations: Implement Playwright for end-to-end testing with WordPress-specific selectors
Use WordPress WP-CLI for programmatic state control in tests
Set up staging environment with test data seeding capabilities
Enable WP_DEBUG and Query Monitor for better observability
Create custom REST API endpoints for test automation
Implement snapshot testing for visual regression
Use WordPress hooks (do_action/apply_filters) for test instrumentation
